More Than Words on Cake Last day, my husband and I celebrated our 10th anniversary. We went for cake! Our request was simple: a small cake, elegantly inscribed with our names and "10th Happy Wedding Anniversary." Since the cake was small, we asked the baker to omit the word "happy" and write just our names and "10th wedding anniversary". The baker, a seasoned gentleman with a twinkle in his eye, paused. "But ma'am," he said, "the 'happy' is what makes it meaningful." He was right. The word "happy" added a symphony of joy to a relationship. So, he took his time, his brush dancing across the cake like a love poem in icing. The final product wasn't just a confection; it was a masterpiece, a testament to his artistry and, even more, his passion for his craft. It was a beautiful reminder: when we do what we love, it shows. The baker could have simply etched what we said, fulfilled the transaction, and moved on. But he didn't. He saw beyond the request, felt the weight of those ten years, and poured his heart onto a canvas of sugar and flour. No matter your field, when you approach your work with love, creativity, and a dedication to making it meaningful, the results are simply delicious. So, today, I ask you: are you pouring your heart into your work? Are you finding ways to add that dash of "happy" to your craft, your interactions, your contributions? Because the world needs your unique passion, your willingness to go beyond the ordinary and create something truly beautiful.
